text: Watch my full Senate floor tribute to Corporal Matt Henderson who died in Iraq in May 2004 while serving our country. #NEHeroes https://t.co/5vDtpJx7TP
label: R

text: I join Nebraskans and Americans across our country in saluting Matt‚Äôs bravery and #sacrifice. It is an honor to tell his story. #NEhero
label: R

text: Matt was a consistent source of inspiration for his fellow Marines, he was the kind of young man that people were just drawn to. He was tough yet a selfless Marine. #SemperFi
label: R

text: For his ultimate sacrifice, Corporal Matt Henderson received the naval achievement medal with cluster, a Purple Heart, and he was the first to receive the prestigious Non-Commissioned Officer Combat Engineer of the Year award posthumously.
label: R

text: Matt warned his squad to get back and take cover but was unable to get out of range himself. The remainder of his squad survived. #Leadership #Service #Sacrifice
label: R

text: As a squad leader, Matt was aware of and concerned about the dangers of his second deployment. On May 26, 2004, Matt was leading his squad in sweeping an area in the Al Anbar province of Iraq. During the sweep, Matt and two of his men were killed when an IED was detonated #NEhero
label: R

text: In February of 2004, Matt deployed to Iraq for the second time and Jaimie moved back to #Nebraska to be closer to their families.
label: R

text: Upon Matt‚Äôs return home in May of 2003, he and Jaimie finally had their big church wedding in Lincoln, NE. They moved to California where Matt was stationed.
label: R

text: During his deployment, Matt was chosen to be a squad leader due to his #leadership abilities & the respect of the other Marines. Matt‚Äôs family had no communication with him during this time and watched the news every evening with the hopes of catching a glimpse of Matt.
label: R

text: In February of 2003, Matt deployed to Iraq where he joined other U.S. led forces in the invasion of Iraq from Kuwait in order to oust Saddam Hussein. #NEhero
label: R

text: On August 4, 2001, Matt proposed to his girlfriend Jaimie on Mission Beach in San Diego just after sunset. As they planned their wedding in Nebraska, Matt‚Äôs unit was informed they would be among the first forces to invade Iraq.
label: R

text: Due to his strong interest in the construction field, Matt also finished Combat Engineer School at Camp Lejeune, and he was assigned to the 1st Combat Engineers Battalion at Camp Pendleton.
label: R

text: In 2000, Matt joined the @USMC because he was attracted to the discipline & direction it offered. He completed boot camp at @MCRD_SD before attending & completing infantry training at @MCIWPendletonCA. #Service
label: R

text: Matt loved sports and was a devout @Huskers and @ChicagoBears fan. #GBR #Tradition
label: R

text: After Matt‚Äôs father finished veterinary school, he moved the family to the Good Life. As Matt grew up, he made many friends and could be found by his dad‚Äôs side on equine veterinary visits.
label: R

text: Happening Now: I am speaking on the Senate floor about the life and service of Nebraska‚Äôs Corporal Matt Henderson. #NEHeroes #Service
label: R

text: On the Senate floor today, I paid tribute to the life & service of @NENationalGuard Sgt. First Class Tricia Jameson of St. Paul, NE. Tricia will always be remembered as a #NEHero. Full video here: https://t.co/4LUKhw3Cxa
label: R

text: Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson loved her family, she embodied the pride of her state and the values of our nation. #NEHeroes #Service üá∫üá∏
label: R

text: For her service to our nation, Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson earned many military decorations, including the Purple Heart and Bronze Star posthumously. #NEHeroes #Service
label: R

text: Sgt. Jameson‚Äôs name and reputation live on as soldiers save lives, just as she did, on the battlefield.
label: R

text: Without hesitation, Sgt. Jameson answered the call. She was speeding towards the battlefield to attend to the fallen when her field ambulance was struck by an IED. That day, she gave her life while serving her country.
label: R

text: Sgt. Jameson and her battle buddy, Specialist Rachelle Spors received an urgent call to help injured Marines in combat a few miles from where they were.
label: R

text: By June of 2005, Sgt. Jameson was in Iraq on duty with the 313th Medical Company at Camp Speicher. Jameson‚Äôs first mission on the road was a long one. She was the vehicle commander of an M997 ambulance that was headed to Trebil near the Jordan border.
label: R

text: With her determination, she raised that program into a world-class operation. The soldiers who took her program went on to save lives around the world.
label: R

text: As combat intensified in #Afghanistan and #Iraq, Tricia was tasked with improving the Combat Life Saver course, which teaches soldiers basic medical skills for the battlefield.
label: R

text: After high school, Tricia joined the @NENationalGuard in 1994. With her grit and determination, she soon was promoted to become a full-time training instructor at Camp Ashland.
label: R

text: Tricia grew up in the farm country of St. Paul, NE, and at a young age, she advocated for what is right and how others should be treated.
label: R

text: Each Nebraska hero has a powerful story, and today, I‚Äôm honoring the life of @NENationalGuard Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson.
label: R
